intro: Ornithogalum iranicum, commonly known as the Persian star-of-Bethlehem, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, and its flowering stems are often adorned with a distinctive star-like pattern. Ornithogalum iranicum prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. It is also valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
